CONTRACTING_BODY.CA_ACTIVITY_OTHER: Defense of Human Rights, Democracy and the Rule of Law

SHORT_DESCR.P: This framework agreement and the subsequent contracts to which it may give rise concern the procurement of consultancy services for publications technologies.
This framework agreement does not specify in detail the object of subsequent contracts and, in particular, does not describe:
— the precise technical and functional characteristics of the services,
— the precise description of the services covered by the subsequent contracts,
— the deadline for submitting bids for the subsequent contracts.
Place of implementation: the premises of the Council of Europe in Strasbourg, or other Council of Europe sites. Some of the services may be provided remotely, via a secure internet connection.
The subsequent contracts may be issued by Directorates of the Council of Europe.

TITLE.P: Lot Nº 1: XML-related technologies and software, especially Arbortext software (including but not limited to development and maintenance of DTD, Schema, XSL/XSLT, FOSI, XSL-FO, MathML, Schematron)

MAIN_SITE.P: Interventions in the other Council of Europe member states: possible,

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot Nº 1: XML-related technologies and software, especially Arbortext software (including but not limited to development and maintenance of DTD, Schema, XSL/XSLT, FOSI, XSL-FO, MathML, Schematron).

TITLE.P: Lot Nº 2: XMLESC an in-house XML tool used for the editing and publication of the Social Charter Conclusions and Findings or other publications (XSL/XSLT, XOPUS, Lucène)

MAIN_SITE.P: Interventions in the other Council of Europe member states: possible,

SHORT_DESCR.P: XMLESC an in-house XML tool used for the editing and publication of the Social Charter Conclusions and Findings or other publications (XSL/XSLT, XOPUS, Lucène).

TITLE.P: Lot Nº 3: Adobe publication tools, including Adobe CC, InCopy, implementation of round-trip editing between InDesign and Word

MAIN_SITE.P: Interventions in the other Council of Europe member states: possible.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot Nº 3: Adobe publication tools, including Adobe CC, InCopy, implementation of round-trip editing between InDesign and Word.

SUITABILITY.P: I. they are in the process of being tried or have been convicted in a final judgement on one or more of the following grounds: involvement in a criminal organisation, corruption, fraud or money laundering;

II. they are in a state of bankruptcy, liquidation, cessation of activities or judicial settlement or in a preventive scheme of arrangement with creditors or any other similar situation resulting from a procedure of the same nature, or are the subject of a procedure of the same nature;
III. have been the subject of a judgment constituting res judicata for an offence concerning their professional conduct or serious professional misconduct;

IV. have not fulfilled their obligations relating to the payment of social security contributions or taxes or other duties, pursuant to the legal provisions of the country in which they are established.
When submitting their bid, each tenderer shall provide a sworn statement attesting to the fact that none of the aforementioned situations apply to them.

INFO_ADD.P: The consultation files shall be made available for download free of charge at this link:
http://extranet.edqm.eu/dropboxout/040A2w1f6ioaImKYv2zyQ8fkgucyxLRJ0cq2qK13dkx/2018-AO-28-Consultancy%20services%20for%20publications%20technologies.zip

Companies that do not wish to download the consultation files may also receive them by e-mail or on a physical electronic medium (USB key) if they send a written request to the address of the Contracting Authority indicated in article 7 of the present tendering rules.

Candidates who have downloaded the consultation file documents are requested to send their contact details by e-mail to purchasing@edqm.eu to allow the Contracting Authority to inform them of any changes arising during the call for tenders.

Contracts, framework contracts and framework agreements awarded by the Council of Europe are governed by the Financial Regulations of the Organisation and by Rule 1333 of 29.6.2011 on the procurement procedures of the Council of Europe.

The organisation enjoys privileges and immunities provided for in the General Agreement on privileges and immunities of the Council of Europe, and its protocols, and the special agreement relating to the Seat of the Council of Europe.

In accordance with the measures in article 11(3) Rule Nº 1333 of 29.6.2011 on the procurement procedures of the Council of Europe, the Contracting Authority stipulates that all bids must be sent in sealed envelopes to the Secretary of the tenders board.
Candidates shall be excluded if:

I. they are in the process of being tried or have been convicted in a final judgement on one or more of the following grounds: involvement in a criminal organisation, corruption, fraud or money laundering;

II. they are in a state of bankruptcy, liquidation, cessation of activities or judicial settlement or in a preventive scheme of arrangement with creditors or any other similar situation resulting from a procedure of the same nature, or are the subject of a procedure of the same nature;
III. have been the subject of a judgment constituting res judicata for an offence concerning their professional conduct or serious professional misconduct;

IV. have not fulfilled their obligations relating to the payment of social security contributions or taxes or other duties, pursuant to the legal provisions of the country in which they are established.
When submitting their bid, each tenderer shall provide a sworn statement attesting to the fact that none of the aforementioned situations apply to them.
The Council of Europe reserves the right to ask the successful tenderer to provide the following supporting documents:

1. for points under a), b) and c) above, a criminal record listing excerpt or, where this is not possible, an equivalent attestation issued by the competent judicial or administrative authorities of the country of incorporation of the tenderer, proving that these requirements are satisfied;
2. for points under d) a certificate issued by the competent authorities of the country of incorporation of the tenderer.
The bids shall be sent by registered letter with acknowledgement of receipt to the following address:
Council of Europe.
Palais de l’Europe – Service du Courrier.
For the attention of the Tenders Board.
"2018-AO-28-DO NOT OPEN".
Avenue de l’Europe.
F-67075 Strasbourg
Bids received after the deadline stipulated in these tendering rules and bids in unmarked envelopes will not be accepted.
The time-limit for sending bids is 4:00 pm on 25.5.2018.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: See Rule 1333 of 29.6.2011 on the procurement procedures of the Council of Europe.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_INFO.OFFICIALNAME: See Rule 1333 of 29.6.2011 on the procurement procedures of the Council of Europe.
